Text: (I wonder if Claire's okay after what happened.)

(She was rambling on about some special power...
She's definitely going through a phase...)

(I'm not sure whether to give her space. I don't want
her sulking over being neglected, either. Maybe I
should check on her.)
I'm coming in, Claire.
Don't!
Huh...?
You should keep your distance from me...
(That bandage... Hmm...)

This might sound a bit crazy, but...there's something
I need to tell you, Cid.
...I feel something inside of me that isn't me!

It's just a vague sensation for now...but if this
something inside me were to hurt you...

(Yep, she's definitely going through something.
No question about it.)

(I figured it might have just had a momentary flight
of fancy, but she's deep in it. I'll just keep my cool
and respond like I normally would.)
I see. Well, that's concerning.

...Your response says it all. I'm really not normal,
am I?
Huh?

You're acting calm just to avoid hurting me,
aren't you?

I realize how crazy I sound. I'm not like everyone
else anymore...
(Right, of course, she interprets it that way...)

(I know how this goes. If I reassure her by saying,
"No, you're just like everyone else," I could hurt
her pride and narrative.)

(On the other hand, if I agree and say, "Yeah, you're
not like everyone else," I risk alienating or even
upsetting her.)
(So, the best answer to give now would be...)

You're you, Claire... What others are or aren't...
doesn't matter...
So don't call yourself crazy.
Cid...

(A heartfelt response from a brother who genuinely
believes in, worries about, and accepts his sister!
Now, let's see how she reacts...)
...Thanks. You might be right.
(Bingo.)
But...why me? Why was I chosen?
(And it's not over yet...)
I just...wanted to protect...

(She's playing up the whole tragic, reluctant heroine
angle...which means there's only one response I
should give...)
Maybe it's some kind of...trial by fire?
Huh?

You know, you're already strong. Maybe the gods are
telling you to become even stronger...

Once you overcome this trial, I'm sure you'll be way,
way stronger!

I see... I hope you're right. If this power is meant
to protect you, then
*gasp* Ack... My hand... Not again, not now!
A-Are you okay? Claire!

(So, the premise is she's battling with something
sealed under those bandages. In that case...)
I should keep my distance, right? Guess I'll go then.

Hold on, don't get the wrong idea! I'm not trying to
push you away. I just...!
It's okay, I get it... See ya.
Hey, wait
...Seriously. He didn't have to run off like that...

(...But it's probably better this way. If this
unknown power inside me...were to hurt anyone,
especially Cid, I'd never forgive myself.)
(It's best he stays away...)
(There's a noise outside the door. Is it...Cid?!)

Claire rushes to open the door, only to find no sign
of anyone.

There's no one there! Seriously, what the hell...
huh?

Wait...bandages and a sandwich? Did Cid leave these
here?
(Good. She doesn't look too annoyed.)

(When it comes to that kind of angst, showing subtle
concern is more effective than a barrage of words.)

(I'm all too familiar with that phase. I'll keep an
eye on her from a distance.)
That boy... When did he get to be so considerate?

And here I thought he'd always be my cute baby
brother following me around...
But... But...!
(It does feel a bit lonely. Cid...you idiot.)

Claire wrestles with an indescribable sense of
anxiety at the distance between her and her
brother...
